answers.answer: Its a little high but not terrible.  Since you have swelling to you may want to rest a lot so it doesn't get out of hand.  Ask your dr just to be safe.  Good luck.

A normal bp is 120/80. Please keep a close watch on your bp. The swelling your having and elevated bp could get out of hand and become preeclampsia. Watch your salt intake and continue to monitor your bp. Your dr is probably making you aware of it before it becomes a problem.As for the arm numbness if it's in your wrists it's probably carpal tunnel. You can get wrist splints at the drug store or at an orthopedic drs office. That's pretty much all you can do at this point. Hopefully it subsides after pregnancy.Hope you get to feeling better soon!Ginger

It's really important that at this stage of pregnancy, as you near the "finish line" that you take it easy as much as you can.  Rest as much as you can, in preparation for the "work" ahead.  I might suggest that a blood pressure readling like that tells me that you are simply doing too much and need to slow down.  Make sure you are drinking plenty of water and concentrate more on taking care of you, so that when the baby comes you will be ready to take care of the baby.  Cheers!

question: I'm 37 Weeks and when I went to Dr my bp was 145/81 is that real high? When should I be concerned and what can I do BC I want to keep walking excising yoga ect but don't want to riskbp getting too high...and myHands and feet keep getting do swollen any thing I cab do? And does anyone else have there arms fall asleep a billion times a day? Its really uncomfortable and it even hurts any suggestions on relief?
title: high blood pressure
